title: Humanist Font with 521 Unicode BT
content:
This font is edited with FontCreator 5.6 Demo Version.

This font includes the Euro Currency, the rupee, the lira, the naira, the mill, the German penny, the peso, the hryvnia, the guarani, the austral and the cedi.

There is also a ₤, copied from the pound sterling.

[This Unicode font](http://web.archive.org/web/20090804053619/http:/typophile.com/files/Humanist%20521%20BT.ttf)
author: 386sky

comments.content:
Tuesday 30th December 3:28

Insert the ts digraph with Insert Characters window.

Complete the composites for ts digraph.

Change it to simple glyph.

Move the s.

Get union of contours.

Cut the unneeded contour with the knife tool.

Move the point.

Get union of contours.

Sort glyphs to Standard Macintosh ordering.

You’ve ran the transformation script: Small Capitals IPA Phonetic Unicode.

You’ve adjusted the bearings for G, I, N, Œ, R, Y, B, H and L which is small capitals.

There is also an improved Ŋ glyph, and small capitals from 2 unicode blocks: IPA Extensions and Phonetic Extensions.

There is also an ts digraph from IPA.

Here is the font (download from Rapid Share):  
 [Download Humanist 521 BT](http://web.archive.org/web/20090804053619/http:/rapidshare.com/files/177911058/Copy_of_Humanist_521_BT.ttf.html)

Add one of these 5 symbols to the Humanist 521 BT Unicode font.

0298 LATIN LETTER BILABIAL CLICK  
029D LATIN SMALL LETTER J WITH CROSSED-TAIL  
0270 LATIN SMALL LETTER TURNED M WITH LONG LEG  
01BE LATIN LETTER INVERTED GLOTTAL STOP WITH STROKE  
01BB LATIN LETTER TWO WITH STROKE

Added that code to Add these characters and/or character ranges. For example: 8364, $FB50 - $FBFF, $FFFC.  
$0298, $029D, $0270, $01BE, $01BB

Clicked the OK button.

Selected 5 incomplete glyphs.

Clicked Complete Composites.

Clicked the 2 with stroke.

Finished the 2 with stroke.

Finished the small j with cross tail.

Finished the small turned m with long leg.

Finished the bilabial click.

Finished the inverted glottal stop with stroke.

There is a bilabial click, a small j with crossed-tail, the small turned m with long leg, the inverted glottal stop with stroke and the digit two with stroke.
